column1: LESSON 6: CHARTS - Making Data Look Pretty
Because nobody reads spreadsheets but everyone loves pictures
(This is how you impress in presentations Aryan)
PART A: MONTHLY SALES DATA (Chart Material)
CHART TYPE GUIDE (When to use what):
Best for: Monthly sales comparison side by side
How: Select data > Insert > Column Chart
BAR CHART - Same as column but horizontal
Best for: When you have long category names
How: Select data > Insert > Bar Chart
LINE CHART - Showing trends over time
Best for: Sales growth showing time
How: Select data > Insert > Line Chart
PIE CHART - Showing parts of a whole (100%)
Best for: Market share budget breakdown
How: Select data > Insert > Pie Chart
WARNING: Only use for 3-6 categories max!
COMBO CHART - Mix of column and line
Best for: Comparing actual vs target
How: Select data > Insert > Combo Chart
PART B: COMBO CHARTS & SECONDARY AXIS (Pro Level!)
When your data has VERY DIFFERENT scales - use a Secondary Axis!
If you plot both on same axis the percentages look like a flat line!
1. Create a Combo Chart (Insert > Combo Chart)
2. Right-click on the data series you want on secondary axis
5. Now you have two Y-axes - left and right!
- Columns for: Online Sales + Store Sales
- Line on Secondary Axis for: Target or Growth %
This is how professionals show Actual vs Target!
(Your boss will think you're a wizard)
PART C: EXPENSE BREAKDOWN (Pie Chart Perfect)
3. Add Data Labels (right click > Add Data Labels)
4. Brag about your savings to friends
PART D: SPARKLINES (Mini Charts Inside Cells!)
Sparklines are tiny charts that fit inside a single cell!
Perfect for showing trends at a glance without taking up space.
1. Click the cell where you want the sparkline (Trend column)
3. Choose type: Line Column or Win/Loss
4. Select your data range (Jan through Jun values)
5. Click OK - magic mini chart appears!
LINE SPARKLINE - Shows trend over time
Best for: Seeing if values go up or down
Best for: Showing gains vs losses
Pro Tip: Add sparklines to dashboards for quick visual summaries!
PART E: CHART CUSTOMIZATION (Make it yours)
Chart Title: Click and type (make it descriptive!)
Aryan Style: "Look How Much We Made!"
Legend: Shows what each color means
Data Labels: Show exact values on chart
Colors: Click any bar/slice > Format > Fill Color
Pro tip: Use company colors or aesthetic palettes
PART F: COMPARISON DATA (Column Chart Material)
1. Clustered Column: Compare products across quarters
2. Stacked Column: See total with breakdown
3. Line Chart: Show trend for each product
5. Combo with Sparklines: Full dashboard view!
PART G: TREND DATA (Line Chart Material)
PRO TIP: Use Combo Chart with Secondary Axis!
- Lines for Visitors Downloads Signups (left axis - big numbers)
- Line for Conversion Rate (right axis - small percentages)
- Add data labels for key points
- Use secondary axis for different scales
- Use 3D charts (they lie and look dated)
- Use pie charts for more than 6 categories
- Use too many colors (rainbow vomit alert)
- Forget to cite your data source
4. Combo chart with secondary axis (Sales vs Target)
5. Add sparklines for each product row
Bonus: Use the same color scheme for all charts
Extra Bonus: Add a company logo (Insert > Picture)
Super Bonus: Create an interactive dashboard with slicers!
Congratulations! You can now make boring data look exciting!
